title: 107_hr5039
content:
The "Humboldt Project Conveyance Act" defines key terms such as Secretary, State, PCWCD, Pershing County, and Lander County. It grants authority to convey title. The Secretary is required to convey all rights to the lands and features of the Humboldt Project, including water rights, to PCWCD, the State, Pershing County, and Lander County, in accordance with specified agreements. All parties must comply with the terms of these agreements. If the conveyance is not completed within 18 months, a report is required. The Secretary must convey rights to the lands and features of the Humboldt Project to specified parties within 18 months. If not completed, a report detailing the conveyance status, obstacles, and anticipated completion date must be submitted to congressional committees. SEC. 4. PAYMENT. PCWCD must pay the United States for the conveyance of lands and facilities. The entity receiving withdrawn lands must also pay fair market value. Administrative costs are split between the Secretary and the entity, except for specific costs. The entity receiving withdrawn lands must pay for boundary surveys, title searches, appraisals, and other real estate transactions. Costs for NEPA reviews are split between the Secretary and the entity. The State of Nevada is not responsible for any payments for land or facilities under this section. The withdrawn lands must be paid for by the entity receiving them, including costs for surveys, appraisals, and other transactions. The State of Nevada is not responsible for any payments for land or facilities. SEC. 5. COMPLIANCE WITH OTHER LAWS.

After the conveyance required by section 3, the district, State, Pershing County, and Lander County must comply with all applicable Federal, State, and local laws for non-Federal water systems.

SEC. 6. REVOCATION OF WITHDRAWALS.

The Secretarial Orders withdrawing lands for Rye Patch Reservoir and Humboldt Sink are revoked upon conveyance required by section 3.

SEC. 7. LIABILITY. SEC. 7. LIABILITY.

The United States will not be liable for damages related to the Humboldt Project, except for negligence prior to conveyance. Liability will not exceed that provided in the Federal Tort Claims Act. Upon conveyance of the lands and facilities by the Secretary under this Act, the Humboldt Project will no longer be a Federal reclamation project. The district will not receive any future reclamation benefits, except those available to other nonreclamation districts.
